page.title: 07HAWICK COMMON RIDING
page.content: My name is Graeme.I'm 11 years old. This is an account of The Friday Chase the most important day of my year. Up at 6 o'clock, change and up to the ponies. Groom them for half an hour, oil their feet and saddle them up.Jump on and off we go to the meeting point.St Mary's clock strikes eight and we're away round the Tower Knowe and up the Howgate.At every window people watch and wave.We part and the married men move to the front.The cornet takes his place followed by unmarried men and the chase begins. As I gallop up the hill I hear people shouting my name but I am concentrating too hard to look and my eyes are watering in the wind.Too soon the chase is over and the Cornet hands the flag to the Acting Father. I'd like to do it all over again but my pony is tired.
